poem:
A Day of Search  

in sudden news—  
a world dissects itself,  
lines of law crossed  
like veins through a leaf.  

the shuffle of feet  
within corridors—  
silent thunder  
in a city balanced  
on whispers.  

pens pause, hearts tight,  
as the morning light  
frays quietly  
from the edge  
of certainty.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "South Korea police raid President Yoon’s office over martial law declaration South Korean police have raided the office of President Yoon Suk Yeol over his role in declaring martial law last week – a move that plunged Asia’s fourth-biggest economy into crisis and caused alarm among its allies.South Korea’s Yonhap news agency said the search on Wednesday was part of an attempt by law enforcement agencies to establish whether Yoon’s actions, supported by other senior". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
